The main gods and founding father of Egypt conspicuously have M-N in their names:

𓏠 𓈖 𓇋 Meni first pharaoh according to Abydos (by Seti I / Ramesses II ) 𓏠 Menes first pharaoh according to Manetho
𓏠 Menes 𓏠 "Men" name of Hor-Aha, heir of Narmer, Athotís Uenéphes = In-nebw ≈ Anubis
𓏠 Main god Min according to Manetho ⇔
𓏠 𓈖 𓃒 𓀸 ⲙⲁⲛⲓ , ⲙⲁⲛⲉⲥⲱⲟⲩ manager man'of'sheep ⲉⲥⲱⲟⲩ sheep "shepherd"
𓋊 Menes 𓋉 Khmin 𓃝 Khmun common
𓄟 Mnaiss
𓀸 Amun 𓇋 𓏠 𓈖 𓅆 𓀮 “√right” “Westerner”

Children of Man see human Herman

Narmer see Noah 𓊕𓈖𓊖

Manasseh, one of the Twelve Tribes

Manasseh or Menashe מְנַשֶּׁה was, according to the Book of Genesis, the first son of Joseph and Asenath.

Manasseh was born in Egypt before the arrival of the children of Israel from Canaan (Genesis 48:5).
Asenath (𓅭𓏏 𓌢𓏏?) was an Egyptian woman whom the Pharaoh gave to Joseph as wife, and the daughter of Potipherah (𐀡𐀴…), a priest of On 𓉺𓏌𓊖 (Genesis 41:50–52).

𓐍 𓅓 𓂜 𓈖 מְנַשֶּׁה Mənaššé "Forgetter" Akkadian: 𒈨𒈾𒋛𒄿 Menasî [me-na-si-i]; Greek: Μανασσῆς Manasses

much later => King Manasseh of Judah (716–662 B.C.E.)
